required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Study to Assess Maternal, Fetal and Infant Outcomes Following Exposure to Rimegepant
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Registry Based, Observational Study to Assess Maternal, Fetal and Infant Outcomes Following Exposure to Rimegepant: The Migraine Observational Nurtec Pregnancy Registry (MONITOR)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to evaluate fetal, maternal, and infant outcomes through 12 months of age.

primary_outcome.description: Healthcare provider report through the registry

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pregnant women with migraine exposed to Rimegepant
Pregnant women with migraine not exposed to Rimegepant

intervention.arm_group_label: Pregnant women with migraine exposed to Rimegepant
Pregnant women with migraine not exposed to Rimegepant

study_pop.textblock: The study population will include pregnant women of any age within the US with migraine who were treated with rimegepant as part of routine care at any time during pregnancy or just prior to pregnancy (up to 3 days prior to conception), as well as pregnant women with migraine not exposed to rimegepant before or during pregnancy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women with migraine exposed to rimegepant: a diagnosis of migraine and at least 1 dose of rimegepant during pregnancy or just prior to pregnancy (up to 3 days prior to conception)
- Pregnant women with migraine unexposed to rimegepant: a diagnosis of migraine and no exposure to Rimegepant before or during pregnancy
Exclusion Criteria:
â€¢ Women exposed to other calcitonin gene-related peptide (CGRP)antagonists (e.g., ubrogepant), CGRP monoclonal antibodies, or ditans (e.g., lasmiditan) at any time during pregnancy or just prior to pregnancy

clinical_study.keyword: Migraine, Migraine Headache, Migraine Disorder, Migraine Prevention, Prevention of Migraine, Pregnant, Pregnancy, Infant
